settings.heading: Hey Girlfriend!
settings.subheading: Catch the latest jewellery scoop by subscribing to our newsletter

settings.overlay_text: Our product assortments are all unique and we offer it for limited time only, ensuring your purchase is as exclusive as your taste. We constantly add new styles to maintain freshness and to ensure your access to something exclusive every time you visit our website. We want you to celebrate every moment and turn cherished experiences into lifelong memories with our wide array of diamond jewellery collections.

settings.overlay_subtext:
Jewelili has jewelry for any & every occasion of your life.
Founded in 2017, Jewelili was launched with the sole purpose of creating affordable fine jewelry. Whether it’s a birthday, an anniversary, a wedding, or just another celebratory moment.
settings.overlay_subtext1: We pride ourselves on offering high quality products at lower values than those available at other jewellers throughout the country. What more, we also have regular flash sales to keep your retail cravings satisfied. Backed by one of the world’s largest fine jewelry manufacturers and knowing the craft well, we are able to extend extraordinary savings to all of our consumers! We are happy, when you are happy and satisfied!

settings.newsletter_subtitle: Subscribe today to get weekly updates!

settings.birthstone_detail: The diverse Garnet is the birthstone for the month of January. Most commonly seen are the red variants and are known to bring the wearer positivity. They are an ideal addition to your 2nd-anniversary celebration.
The striking Amethyst is the birthstone for February. It comes in many shapes and sizes and is considered a symbol of empowerment and strength. They make for a lovely 6th-anniversary present.

The beautiful Aquamarine is the birthstone for all those born in March. Symbolizing the purity of spirit and soul, it is known to protect the wearer's well-being and can also be presented at a 19th-anniversary celebration.

The birthstone of April, diamonds offer a brilliance like no other. Scintillating and sparkling, it is a symbol of clarity, strength, and eternal love. They are also an ideal gift of choice for a 60th and 75th wedding anniversary.
Emerald is the birthstone for May. A symbol of rebirth, it is believed to grant the owner foresight and good fortune. They are an ideal gift for a 20th or 35th wedding anniversary.

The birthstone for June symbolizes plenty of personality traits ranging from wisdom, purity, and wealth. Pearls have been wildly popular in jewelry for centuries because of their natural beauty and make for a great wedding gift.
Ruby is the birthstone for July. Known as a symbol of power and youthful energy, it is also known to soothe anger. They are traditionally given for the 15th and 40th wedding anniversaries.

Peridot is the birthstone for August and is the world’s most popular and affordable gem, known to bring the wearer prosperity and good fortune. It looks great at any time of the day and is given to celebrate a 16th wedding anniversary.

The September birthstone is the beautiful Sapphire symbolizing sincerity, truth, faithfulness, and nobility. Sapphires make stunning gifts for anyone born in September or celebrating a 5th or 45th wedding anniversary.

The newer October birthstone, the Tourmaline means a “stone with mixed colors” Different colors of Tourmaline are thought to have their own healing properties and are traditionally given to celebrate the 8th wedding anniversary.

Citrine is the birthstone for November. Popular as a stone that soothes tempers and calms the wearer, it is an extremely popular and pretty gemstone. They are an ideal gift given to celebrate the 13th wedding anniversary.

The exquisite Tanzanite is the birthstone for December and is one of the most striking gems known to transform negative thoughts and energies into positive ones. They are an ideal gem given to celebrate the 24th wedding anniversary.
